title: How Kerala eradicated extreme poverty
description: On November 1, the Kerala government is set to declare the State extreme poverty-free, the culmination of a four-year-long strenuous exercise. Four lakh enumerators fanned out across the State and identified the most marginalised. The local bodies then devised micro-plans to suit each family. The government claims that the programme uplifted 1,03,099 people from extreme poverty. S.R. Praveen interacts with some of the beneficiaries and also listens to dissenting voices

description: Red Chillies Entertainment argues that IRS officer Sameer Wankhede's defamation suit against its Netflix series "The Bads of Bollywood" is "misconceived." The production house stated the show is situational satire, does not name Wankhede, and that his reputation was already damaged by a CBI FIR prior to its release.

title: RJD’s challenge in Siwan: Shahabuddin is dead. Long live Shahabuddin
Justice Surya Kant appointed as 53rd CJI; oath on Nov 24
description: Justice Surya Kant has been appointed as the 53rd Chief Justice of India. He will formally take oath on November 24, succeeding Chief Justice Bhushan Gavai, and will become the first top justice from Haryana.

TTP dy chief dead: Amjad killed in cross-border fire; Pak PM hails troops
description: Pakistan's security forces killed Amjad, the TTP's second-in-command and a high-value target, along with three other militants during an foiled infiltration attempt from Afghanistan into Bajaur district. President Zardari and Prime Minister Sharif lauded the operation, emphasising Pakistan's commitment to defeating elements harming innocent people.

description: Reliance Industries and Google are joining forces. Eligible Jio users will receive 18 months of free Google AI Pro. This initiative aims to make artificial intelligence accessible to everyone in India. Young Jio 5G users aged 18 to 25 will be the first to benefit. The partnership also extends to enterprise AI solutions, empowering Indian businesses with advanced AI tools and infrastructure.

description: New banking regulations starting November 1, 2025, will allow up to four nominees for bank accounts and safety lockers. SBI Card is also updating its fee structure for education payments and wallet reloads. Additionally, PNB is reducing locker rent, and government pensioners have extended deadlines for life certificate submissions and NPS transitions.

Inside Mumbai hostage scare: How cops stormed studio; what was accused's motive?
description: Young actor aspirants were held hostage at a Mumbai studio by a self-proclaimed filmmaker demanding to speak to certain individuals. Police successfully stormed the studio, rescuing 19 hostages, including 17 children, and apprehending the suspect. The motive is believed to be work-related dues, with the suspect appearing mentally unstable.

title: Karnataka State Administrative Tribunal stays suspension of Panchayat officer for participating in RSS rally
IPL: Abhishek Nayar named KKR head coach; replaces Chandrakant Pandit
description: Abhishek Nayar has been appointed as the new head coach of Kolkata Knight Riders, succeeding Chandrakant Pandit. Nayar, a long-standing member of the KKR setup since 2018, brings progressive coaching methods and a player-centric philosophy to the role. He will work alongside mentor Dwayne Bravo as KKR embarks on its next phase.

Forgetfulness to fatigue: 6 early warning signs of accelerated brain aging
description: Forgetfulness and fatigue might signal accelerated brain aging, not just stress. Subtle shifts in energy, inflammation, and sleep patterns can impact neuron communication. Identifying early signs like mental fatigue, word recall issues, poor sleep, irritability, sensory hypersensitivity, and post-meal brain fog is crucial. Lifestyle and metabolic factors can help slow this process.

F-1 visa and EAD renewal: Jobs at risk; what Indian students need to know
description: The United States has ended the automatic work permit extensions for some immigrants. This new rule, effective October 30, 2025, requires stricter checks before employment authorisations are renewed. International students on OPT, including STEM extensions, will be significantly impacted. They must stop working if their permit expires before renewal approval, creating potential job gaps and income loss.

description: A man, identified as Rohit Arya, took 19 people, including 17 children, hostage in a Mumbai flat on Thursday. Arya died in a police crossfire after threatening to harm himself and the children. All children were safely rescued, and police suspect work-related dues as the motive.

Bank holidays in November: Check complete state-wise list
description: Banks across India will observe multiple holidays in November 2025, impacting physical operations due to various national, regional, and cultural festivals. While digital services remain active, customers are advised to consult the RBI's state-specific holiday list for in-person banking plans. Key observances include Kannada Rajyothsava, Guru Nanak Jayanti, and Meghalaya's Wangala Festival.

title: After success in New Delhi, Railways to develop passenger holding areas at 76 stations by 2026 festival season

description: A prominent computer science professor predicts Salesforce will be the first major tech company disrupted by AI, sparking widespread debate. Experts argue AI's superior data handling capabilities and tailored solutions threaten traditional CRM models.

Big diplomatic win: India gets 6-month waiver from US sanctions on Chabahar port
description: The US has granted India a six-month exemption from sanctions on the Chabahar port, a significant diplomatic achievement amidst ongoing trade deal negotiations. This development allows India to continue its investments and strategic access to Afghanistan and Central Asia. India is also analysing the implications of US sanctions on Russian oil companies, prioritising energy security for its population.

description: India is carefully reviewing the impact of new US sanctions on Russian oil companies. The nation reiterated its commitment to securing affordable energy for its 1.4 billion people, prioritising national interests and diverse sourcing. Meanwhile, US President Donald Trump said India's been "very good" in efforts to reduce Russian oil imports.

description: Pakistan has admitted to a US drone agreement during Pakistan-Afghanistan peace talks, causing Afghan negotiators to demand written guarantees against drone use in their airspace. The talks collapsed as Pakistan blamed Kabul for refusing to act against militants, with Islamabad vowing to protect its people from terrorism.

‘Main kyu gaali khaun’: Nitin Gadkari orders QR codes on highway sites
description: The road transport ministry is leveraging social media for highway project transparency. NHAI and builders will now upload construction videos on YouTube for public feedback. QR codes on national highways will display contractor and official details, ensuring accountability for road quality. This initiative aims to enhance public participation and deliver international-standard roads.

title: Farah Khan, who delivered three blockbusters including Rs 300 crore hit, says she has made the ‘maximum money’ from her vlog with cook Dilip
Men call AI, data analytics masculine; gendered meritocracy exists; equality feels hollow
description: In a world that claims progress, bias has merely changed its form. A new Capgemini Research Institute report reveals that while women match men in confidence and capability, nearly half of male leaders still label AI and innovation skills as “masculine.” The patriarchy, it seems, has not vanished—it has simply learned to code.

description: Speaking at an election rally in Kishanganj on Wednesday, Owaisi referred to VIP chief Vikas Sahani and said that if a leader from the Malla community can be projected for the deputy chief minister's post, then a leader from the Muslim community can also aim for the positions of Chief Minister and even Prime Minister.

title: Racy clips & blackmail: Inside cold-blooded 'live-in murders'; what's pushing partners to kill?
description: Once a symbol of freedom, live-in relationships in India are now linked to chilling incidents of betrayal, violence, and death. From brutal murders to gruesome dismemberment, recent cases highlight a disturbing trend where possessiveness and jealousy escalate into extreme violence, challenging societal norms and legal interpretations.

title: Stefon Diggs linked to Drake’s ‘Kiki’ pregnancy while expecting with Cardi B
description: A shocking rumour has emerged concerning NFL star Stefon Diggs.  While Cardi B is confirmed to be pregnant with his child, DJ Akademiks alleges Diggs also got K'yanna Barber pregnant. Barber is famously known as 'Kiki' from Drake's hit song 'In My Feelings'. This news has sparked widespread online discussion and memes.
